channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Actor
channel.description: Latest threat actor threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Nike Probes Data Breach Claim by 'WorldLeaks' Extortion Group
item.description:
Global apparel giant Nike has launched an investigation into a potential data breach after being listed as a victim by the 'WorldLeaks' data extortion group. The group, which emerged in 2025 and focuses on data theft without deploying ransomware, threatened to publish stolen Nike data on January 24....

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Sandworm Deploys New 'DynoWiper' Malware in Failed Attack on Polish Power Grid
item.description:
The Russian state-sponsored hacking group Sandworm has been attributed with a major, albeit unsuccessful, cyberattack against Poland's power system in late December 2025. Poland's energy minister described it as the 'largest cyber attack' on their energy infrastructure in years. Cybersecurity firm E...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks
item.description:
The notorious cyber extortion syndicate ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for breaching business intelligence firm Crunchbase and financial advisory company Betterment. According to the threat actor, the initial access was gained by using sophisticated voice phishing (vishing) attacks to socia...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach, Threat Actor

item.title: Everest Ransomware Group Leaks 343GB of Under Armour Customer Data
item.description:
The Russia-linked Everest ransomware group has leaked 343 GB of data allegedly stolen from global sportswear brand Under Armour. The massive data dump, which occurred on January 24, 2026, followed a failed extortion attempt. The leaked data is reported to contain the personally identifiable informat...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: North Korean Hackers Lure Developers with Fake Job Interviews, Backdoor macOS via VS Code
item.description:
State-sponsored threat actors from North Korea, including the Lazarus Group, are targeting software developers in a sophisticated campaign dubbed 'Contagious Interview.' According to Jamf Threat Labs, the attackers use fake job offers to entice developers, particularly in the crypto and fintech sect...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Osiris' Ransomware Borrows TTPs from Medusa and Inc Gangs, Uses Signed Driver to Kill AV
item.description:
A new ransomware strain named Osiris is demonstrating a high level of sophistication by combining tactics from established ransomware groups like Medusa and Inc. The attackers use Rclone for data exfiltration to Wasabi cloud storage and deploy a version of Mimikatz named `kaz.exe`, both TTPs linked ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: INC Ransomware OPSEC Fail: Reused Infrastructure Leads to Data Recovery for 12 U.S. Victims
item.description:
A significant operational security (OPSEC) failure by the INC ransomware group has allowed cybersecurity firm Cyber Centaurs to recover stolen data for twelve U.S. organizations. The discovery was made after analyzing an attack involving the RainINC ransomware variant. Researchers found artifacts fr...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Incident Response, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Anubis RaaS Ups the Ante with Destructive 'Wipe Mode' to Maximize Extortion
item.description:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named Anubis is gaining attention for its destructive capabilities. Evolving from a prototype called 'Sphinx,' Anubis offers its affiliates a dual-execution model. In addition to standard encryption, the malware can be run with a `/WIPEMODE` parameter t...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: China-Linked APT 'UAT-8837' Targets North American Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
A new report from Cisco Talos has identified a China-nexus Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group, tracked as UAT-8837, actively targeting critical infrastructure organizations in North America since at least 2025. The group gains initial access by exploiting public-facing vulnerabilities, including...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Everest Ransomware Leaks Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers After Failed Talks
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a massive data breach against athletic apparel giant Under Armour. After negotiations allegedly failed, the group announced on its dark web leak site that it has published the full dataset, which it claims contains 191 million records, including 72.7 million ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor
